etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + phonetic 厄(厄) (è, "difficulty") -> sound of something stuck in the throat
etymology.interpretation: The character 呃(呃) (è) represents an interjection or sound made when one is surprised or hesitant, often associated with a momentary pause or difficulty in speech, hence the use of 厄(厄) (è, "difficulty") as the phonetic component.

examples.chinese: 呃(呃)，我还没想好呢(我還沒想好呢)。
examples.pinyin: È, wǒ hái méi xiǎng hǎo ne.

examples.chinese: 刚开始的时候(剛開始的時候)，他呃说错了(他呃說錯了)。
examples.pinyin: Gāng kāishǐ de shíhòu, tā è shuō cuò le.
examples.english: At the beginning, he, uh, misspoke.
